title.narrative: OUTPUT 3.1 ENABLING ENVIRONMENT

description.narrative: Output 3.1. Strengthened legislative, policy, budgetary and institutional frameworks that protect children from all forms of violence in Uganda by 2025., which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3. By 2025, children in Uganda especially the most vulnerable and those affected by humanitarian situations are protected from all forms of violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation, including harmful practices, and realize their right to legal identity

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3.1. Strengthened legislative, policy, budgetary and institutional frameworks that protect children from all forms ofviolence in Uganda by 2025.

description.narrative: The National Child Policy was disseminated in 51 districts and supported the establishment of respective district child wellbeing committees. The Social Care and Support Technical Working Group was established for coordinated development partner and CSO support to government. Alignment of structures and services in refugee settlements with those in host communities, including strengthened engagement with government, resulted from UNICEF/UNHCR leadership of the National Refugee Child Protection Sub-Working Group. The national Civil Registration and Vital Statistics Strategic Plan was approved and national consensus built among stakeholders to support the government to build one harmonized national child protection management information system.; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:08/01/2022

title.narrative: Country routinely collects and publishes key types of administrative data on violence, exploitation and abuse of children, disaggregated by age and sex, Text

target.value: 2025:3 of 3 Sector - MGLSD consolidated annual report with Administrative data from JLOS, Health sectors and Social service sectors, as well as DLGs and partners on violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation of children

actual.value: 2021:UBOS released latest data on violence against children and women. The JLOS annual report has administrative data from MGLSD, DLGs and Uganda Police on violence, abuse, neglect and exploitation of children.

title.narrative: Country has a functioning, national, multi-sectoral, multi-stakeholder coordination mechanism tasked with overseeing national plans or strategies to prevent and respond to violence against children and adolescents, with child and adolescent participation, Text

target.value: 2025:Multi-sectoral, multi-stakeholder coordination mechanism established and functional

actual.value: 2021:The national multi-sectoral and Inter-Ministerial Child Wellbeing Committee is in place, functional and supported dissemination of the national child policy in 50 districts in 2021.
